events.message: Policyholder submitted a claim after being involved in a car collision at a traffic intersection during rush hour.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident based on keywords detected in the initial filing form regarding vehicle collision.
An experienced auto claims agent was assigned to handle the investigation process and guide the customer through next steps.
The customer received formal acknowledgment of the claim submission including important contact and process information.
Request sent for police report, photographs of vehicle damage, and driver’s license as supporting documentation.
Customer uploaded all requested documents including the detailed police accident report and multiple damage photos.
Assigned claim investigator began review of submitted evidence, spoke with witnesses, and checked vehicle repair estimates.
All investigative activities concluded; report compiled summarizing facts around the auto collision and liability assessment.
A settlement offer covering vehicle repair costs and rental car expenses was sent to the policyholder for review.
Customer expressed appreciation for quick communication and seemed satisfied with the proposed settlement amount.
Management approved the claim settlement after final review of investigator’s findings and customer feedback.
Settlement payment was issued and transferred to the policyholder’s bank account to cover repair and rental charges.
The claim file was closed successfully following payment confirmation and no further inquiries or disputes.
